results.creator_credit: Christopher Daw and Text Book Films
results.brief_description: The term productivity is comprehensively defined after which consideration is given to the productivity levels and capacities of various countries.

results.title: The Huntsman
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of a short story by Toronto writer David Lewis Stein about a ten-year-old boy who ferrets out golf balls from the rough, then sells his findings to passing golfers. There is an unexpected development when two unscrupulous older boys try to muscle in on his business. A children’s film, but one that many adults will enjoy.

results.title: Bighorn: Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep, Banff and Jasper National Parks
results.creator_credit: Bill Schmalz, Bill Brind and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A far closer view, and a more complete one, than even the hardiest and most patient of visitors is likely to get of the bighorn mountain sheep of the Canadian Rocky Mountains. “Bighorn” is a film distinguished by its camerawork (Bill Schmalz). It catches the characteristic behavior of the bighorns from birth to mating time. Few animals are more arresting in appearance or activity than these dancers of the high ledges. Awards: Novi Sad; Spindleruv Mlyn; Philadelphia; Tarbes.

results.title: The Hands
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
This pantomime, performed by Marcel Marceau is an allegory of good and evil. The struggle between them is revealed by the force of the hands through symbolic movements. Assisted by Pierre Verry. Introduced by Marcel Marceau. Music by the Russian Cathedral Orthodox Choir, Paris.

results.title: Gotterdammerung: fall of the Third Reich
results.creator_credit: Jack Kaufman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Rise and fall of the Third Reich”.
Third and final part of a series based on the book by William L. Shirer ‘The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich’. This episode deals with the period 1941-1945, showing the first gradual and then accelerated reverses of the German army.

Episode of Series “The Rise and fall of the Third Reich”.

results.title: Nazi Germany: years of triumph
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Rise and fall of the Third Reich”.
Second episode of a three part series. Covers the period prior to the Reichstag fire in 1932 to the Dunkirk evacuation. Based on the book by William L. Shirer. Narrated by Richard Basehart. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: If at first you don't succeed: you don't succeed [Colour version]
results.creator_credit: Peter Goodchild, Edward Goldwyn and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
If a mother does badly in bringing up her child in the first 5 years of his life, then the child has almost no chance of success in school. Child psychologists can now measure a new-born baby’s capacity for solving complex problems and they have found that the infant’s motivation is the sheer joy of solving the problems, but if the potential is not developed the damage is irreversible. The results of this research are having major implications for education.

results.title: Happiness Is
results.creator_credit: Clorinda Warny, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: For a young mother happiness can be an hour’s stroll in the park with her sleeping infant—but happiness is short-lived when the baby begins to cry and the passers-by pause with freely proffered advice. Made of animated paper cut-outs, this film without words is a spoof about the self-styled child experts who are so caught up with their own views of what’s best for a child that they fail to see the infant’s real problem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clorinda Warny, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
